body.p:
In all probability my Dear Friend you have by this time
heard of my arrival, as I requested Mr. Raphael Moses to write as soon as I
had landed, which he promised to do—I was extremely indisposed during the
whole passage & found myself incapable of partaking of the slightest
sustenance, I received the kindest & most polite attention from my fellow
passengers, which is you know, the only ameliorating Circumstance we derive
from pain. I did not see the Captain more than twice, he was not very attentive
to me, but I suppose he had a great deal to attend to I was not out of my Birth for five
Days so you may Judge how weak I must have been when I arrived. My Cousin
Isaac Mordecai, met me at the landing & I was received with the most
gratifying affection by my Mothers Relatives who do all in their power to
Render me comfortable. I have a very severe cough, also an oppression on my
Breast, almost as severe, as ever poor Mortal was afflicted with, I have had the
cough about five days, I cannot say, that as yet, I feel much better than when I left
Philadelphia, but decidedly better than when I landed. Martha will be surprised
to see me look in bad Health, as she knows nothing of my late indisposition, but I wrote
that she was glad to hear that I was enjoying good health, the one that wrote the
letter for her must have made a mistake for she wrote to Aunt Judith what I had
written her from Baltimore and to beg her to let her know if she had heard how I was, that
she had not heard from me for some time. I have received many Visits since
my arrival, a great proportion of the Respectable part of the Congre
gation, have already called, many of my Mother's oldest & most
valued Friends are Residents here, who seem disposed to pay me more
attention, but I have no inclination whatever to visit at present, and I am fearful
I shall never feel more disposed for it than I now do. I stay at Cousin Moses's who continues
The letter is torn at bottom left corner, obscuring some words.

to be as much a favorite with me as he ever was with his wife also I am
much pleased, as they endeavour to contribute all they can to Render me
comfortable & happy— Mrs. Moses I find woman of delightful
manners & fine conversation and if I may be allowed to Judge on so short
an acquaintance, I should take her to be possesed of the noblest and best feelings
I am assured she will do all in her power to Render my time agreeable_I
passed last Friday evening & Sabbath with her. She is a very strict Jewess, I am
sorry to say that she is the only one of my Friends here, that I can eat with
as none of them are particular they all eat trafer? Meat, butter and Meat to
gether they think very fine, much good may it do them. I have never yet in
my life eaten any thing of the kind and I am determined I never will let me
feel the deprivation ever so much. Mr R Moses leaves here on Thursday for
New York, he will soon be in your City he says, he can then tell you how much
attention I have received from the Congregation I would mention the names if I knew
them all, but as I do not, and I still have a pain in my head, so the sooner I am done
writing the better indeed I did not see more than half that called as I was in bed
the day they commenced calling. I cannot close without assuring you
that I shall ever Retain the unfailing remembrance of the kindnesses
you have exerted towards me & hope the time may arrive that will
give me an opportunity of Returning it. which pray God may be soon
I shall calculate on receiving a friendly letter from you soon, please mention how my
Relatives are in Baltimore to whom you must present my most affectionate Remembrance
whenever you write, also when you write to New York Remember me to Aunt
Rebecca and Family that I shall write to them as soon as my health will permit me
to do so Remember me to all who may enquire after me in Philadelphia whom at the same
time you may assure that nothing but ill health prevented me from calling
to see, before I left the City. Present me affectionately to Mr Peixatto
& family—tell Misses R & S that I was unfortunately too sick during
the passage to open the Box, so Bountifully Provided by their kindness
Please remember me also to Mr Cohen Mrs Cousins Mr Spires
mama is expected here

p.rend: The paper torn at bottom, obscuring a few words; letter continues written down right side of page.

body.p:
Mr P family must excuse my not
writing to them
and except for yourself the best remembrance of your friend

I wish to write a note on this sheet to Clara Marks
you can confer a favour on me by sealing it and sending
it to her
don't show this letter
write soon

p.rend: The following is written on the right side of the page, divided from the above by a line.

body.p:
I forgot to mention that a
great many of my Friends here express
a great wish to see you RJ

Mr Jos Lazarus Sisters have just
sent for me to a? large Party at
their House to morrow evening they
called last Sabbath. I sent word that
they must excuse me that I was
entirely to sick to excep of them
